required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Articaine and Prilocaine for Extraction of Maxillary Teeth
clinical_study.official_title: Does Articaine, Rather Than Prilocaine, Increase the Success Rate of Anaesthesia for Extraction of Maxillary Teeth

brief_summary.textblock: Ninety-five patients, aged between 16 and 70 years old, were included in this study. Patients were divided into two groups. Group one received Articaine 4% with 1:00.000 Adrenalines. Group two received Prilocaine with 3% Felypressin (0.03 I.U. per ml). Onset time of anaesthesia was objectively evaluated by using electronic pulp testing.

detailed_description.textblock: 85 patients in this study had successful local anaesthetic followed by extraction within the study duration time (10 minutes). However, there were six patients with failure anaesthesia (5 in prilocaine group and 1 in articaine group). By application Person's Chi-square test (x2), there were no significant differences in the number of the episodes of the anaesthetic success between articaine and prilocaine groups at time intervals (P-value = 0.5). T- test showed there have been no important variations within the mean onset time of anaesthesia for articaine and prilocaine buccal infiltrations (P-value =0.1).

primary_outcome.measure: Does articaine, rather than prilocaine, increase the success rate of anaesthesia for extraction of maxillary teeth
primary_outcome.description: to compare the anaesthetic performances of 3% prilocaine (the safest local anaesthetic) with 4 % articaine (the local anaesthetic with fastest onset time of action) when used for maxillary teeth extraction

arm_group.description: if the patient was in articaine group, buccal infiltration technique was applied by inserting a short needle at the height of buccal sulcus along the long axis of the subject tooth for extraction.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Prilocaine with 3% Felypressin (0.03 I.U. per ml)
arm_group.description: if the patient was in prelocaine group, buccal infiltration technique was applied by inserting a short needle at the height of buccal sulcus along the long axis of the subject tooth for extraction.

intervention.description: Articaine 4% is dental local anaesthetic agent
prilocaine is dental local anaesthetic agent
intervention.arm_group_label: Prilocaine with 3% Felypressin (0.03 I.U. per ml)
Prilocaine with 3% Felypressin (0.03 I.U. per ml)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients have one or two upper teeth for extraction, subject tooth or its adjacent must be vital, healthy patient or patient with mild systemic diseases (class I or II according to American Society of Anesthesiology).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients excluded from this study if they have allergy to local anaesthetic agents or need surgical, or multiple teeth extraction.

patient_data.ipd_description: it will be provided on demand
